sense.name: mountaintop
sense.commentary: peak, crown, crest, top, tip, summit - the top point of something
sense.examples: The view from the peak was magnificent. They clambered to the summit of Monanock. At the peak of the pyramid.

sense.name: highest level
sense.commentary: extreme, peak, flower, prime, peak, heyday, bloom, blossom, efflorescence, flush, acme, height, elevation, pinnacle, summit, superlative, top - the highest level or degree attainable; the period of greatest prosperity or productivity; the most extreme possible amount or value
sense.examples: voltage peak... The peak of his career was in the 1960s. His landscapes were deemed the peak of beauty. The artist's gifts are at their peak. At the peak of her career she was mediocre at best. The peak of perfection... Summer was at its peak. ...catapulted Einstein to the peak of fame. The peak of his ambition lasted through his retirement. So many peaks achieved by man... At the peak of his performance he was the best.

sense.name: V shape
sense.commentary: point, tip, peak - a V shape
sense.examples: The cannibal's teeth were filed to sharp points.

sense.name: brim
sense.commentary: bill, peak, eyeshade, visor, vizor - a brim that projects to the front to shade the eyes
sense.examples: He pulled down the bill of his cap and trudged ahead.
